newsitem.title: GERMANY: Frankfurt air cargo volumes continue rise in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Frankfurt air cargo volumes continue rise in Sept.

text.p: The German air cargo market is continuing its recovery of the last few months, Frankfurt airport traffic figures showed.
Cargo handled at Frankfurt, the largest German airport, rose 4.8 percent in September compared to 12 months previously to 116,896 tonnes, the monthly Flughafen Frankfurt Main AG (FAG) report said.
Over the first three quarters of 1996, cargo volumes have grown 2.2 percent to 995,317 tonnes, the market research report added.
This cumulative growth figure is the highest since cargo at Frankfurt airport began to pick up in May from a start of year slump, FAG figures showed.
Exports rose 6.2 percent in September and for Jan-Sept are running at 3.8 percent above last year, the report said.
Imports increased 3.8 percent in September and are 1.1 percent up on the first nine months of 1996.
Domestic cargo, making up five percent of Frankfurt's total airfreight, grew 30 percent in September mostly as a result of inter-continental connecting and distribution freight, the FAG report noted.

Cargo carried on freighter flights continued to rise faster than belly cargo in September and has risen five percent compared to 0.4 percent growth for belly cargo over the first nine months. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+44 171 542-5017
